revisionDesc.change: removed two ptrs to notes no longer necessary with merged files
merged with loc.04728 and renamed hyb.00002; formerly yal.00309
Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Transcribe 2 Pages, regularize spelling, annotate Mrs. Black, O'Connor, Lane, Kirkwood

body.p:
i will resume my corresspondence correspondence again haint you missed my letters very much i am quite glad to resume again well maty is gone she started monday Monday at 5 oclock o'clock i suppose if she has met with no delays she is home to night we miss her very much although we have had company every day this week helen price was here on monday and mrs Black yesterday and a lady to day has just gone after staying to tea and i got it with such pain that i could hardly hardly keep from groaning the matter is i have been on my feet so much lately that i have suffered very much and to day i thought i would keep still and try to get rested but i shall go to bed soon and try to rest we have had quite a number of people to see matt but
only called mrs Lane and mrs kirkwood they only called) but we had anna vanwyk 2 days last week and altogether i got kind of worked down but i shall get rested now i think it was much better for matt to not go to washingtonWashington this winter but she made such preperations preparations for it that she could hardly give it up say to mrs Oconor O'Connor that marthe thanked her for her kind letter and will write to her as soon as she gets a little rested from he journy Journey remember me also to mr and mrs Oconor O'Connor and Jennie also martha was very much better when she left than when she came you cant cant think how she improvee before she went away she had a good appetite when she came she could not eat but very litle little the doctor sounded her lungs with rather favorable result her left lung is good and three fourths of the right one) it had not made such progress as he anticipated) she slept up stairs but had no fire except the very cold nights as it made her coughfcough) she wants to come out there without fail) davis has been here on his way to lowel he said he never was in a place he liked so well as st louisSt. Louis

matt has a beautifullbeautiful gold watch Jeff got that before he left and a large plated ice picker and lots of things and left her 40 dollars well matt like she see so many things she wanted that she got through with all the money george was to let her have what money she wanted by Jeffs wish and George went away before the 1 of the month and didentdidn't get his salary he told me to give matty the rent but as we have a new comer down stairs a girl baby they were a little behind in paying the rent
so she wrote to Jeff and he sent her a draft for 50 dollars and i let her have 5 dol she had none too much to go such a journey i hope she is safe home

matt is as kind to me as she can be she said she would she would send the 5 back when she got home i wished her to take it s now walter dear i must close as i want eddy to put it in the box to night we had a terrible storm here this morngmorning but cleared off the afternoafternoon) your letter and contents came all safe waltewalter dear
